  "description": "Palladium is a global leader in the design, development and delivery of Positive Impact - the intentional creation of enduring social and economic value. We work with foundations, investors, governments, corporations, communities and civil society to formulate strategies and implement solutions that generate lasting social, environmental and financial benefits.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position:&nbsp;Finance Assistant

Job Location: The Finance Assistant will be based in Kano Kano.
Duration: Fixed Term.
Compensation Type: Monthly
Reports to: The Finance Manager

Job Purpose


	The Finance Assistant is part of the Lafiya Programme&rsquo;s Support Team, providing financial management support to the programme.
	The Finance Assistant will work with the Support Unit to maintain the programme financial records, support the Finance Coordinator on the daily routine financial functions in line with value for money principles, in accordance with the programme budget, contractual obligations, company policies, Group Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) and Guidelines and client rules and regulations.
	They will utilise reporting from Palladium&rsquo;s Enterprise Resource System, and MS Excel analytics to provide required inputs and reporting for the programme team, the Project Manager and the Programme Leadership, and Palladium&rsquo;s Corporate Financial Management Team.


Primary Duties And Responsibilities
The Finance Assistant - Kano shall be responsible for the following:

Accounting &amp; Financial Management:


	Provide initial review of all invoices/payment requests and initiate timely action in line with Project procedures/processes towards processing such payments;
	Support in preparation of weekly Field Vouchers for review and final submission by the Finance Manager.
	Manage all staff travel/activity advances, ensuring they are timeously liquidated, reconciled and reported in line with Lafiya Programme procedures.
	Support the Finance Manager in accounts reconciliations, which includes but not limited to:


Activity Advance Liquidation:


	Preparations and review of payment vouchers.
	Reconciliation of vendors&rsquo; statements prior to payment of any invoices;
	Support the Finance Manager in Overseeing the maintenance of robust filing system for easy retrieval of documents, finance documentation - both hard and electronic copies.
	Assist the Finance Manager in preparation of HQ monthly spending forecasts, trackers maintenance and expenditure variance reporting.
	Provide effective cover in the event of the absence of the Finance Coordinator from duty.
	Any other duties as directed by the Finance Manager.


Reporting Requirements:
The role reports to the National Finance Manager. Reporting requirements include:


	Provision of regular updates to the Finance Manager
	Monthly submission of HQ forecasts;
	Weekly Field Vouchers
	Post payment reviews of PVs for audit preparations
	Other reporting as requested by the line manager.


Relationships:


	The role will form part of the Project Financial Management team and will work closely with members of the Lafiya Programme team (and particularly the Finance Manager) as well as other Palladium programme teams in Nigeria, Financial Management team members across the company and the technical Practice Areas.
	The role liaises with the Finance Coordinator, Finance Manager, HQ Technical Teams, the broader Lafiya Administration team, vendors, service providers, and other project staff and stakeholders as required.


Required Qualifications


	University Degree or its equivalent in Business Administration, Accounting, Project Management or Social Sciences.
	Progressive years of experience providing finance support.
	Excellent cross-cultural communication and interpersonal skills demonstrated by ability to interact professionally with culturally and linguistically diverse staff, clients and consultants.
	Ability to prioritise and manage a variety of activities with attention to detail.
	Intermediate level skills in Microsoft Office Suite and comfortable in a Windows PC environment.

Finance Assistant Job at Palladium




        
    

        
        Palladium is a global leader in the design, development and delivery of Positive Impact - the intentional creation of enduring social and economic value. We work with foundations, investors, governments, corporations, communities and civil society to formulate strategies and implement solutions that generate lasting social, environmental and financial benefits.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Finance Assistant

Job Location: The Finance Assistant will be based in Kano Kano.
Duration: Fixed Term.
Compensation Type: Monthly
Reports to: The Finance Manager

Job Purpose
     

            
    




	The Finance Assistant is part of the Lafiya Programme’s Support Team, providing financial management support to the programme.
	The Finance Assistant will work with the Support Unit to maintain the programme financial records, support the Finance Coordinator on the daily routine financial functions in line with value for money principles, in accordance with the programme budget, contractual obligations, company policies, Group Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) and Guidelines and client rules and regulations.
	They will utilise reporting from Palladium’s Enterprise Resource System, and MS Excel analytics to provide required inputs and reporting for the programme team, the Project Manager and the Programme Leadership, and Palladium’s Corporate Financial Management Team.


Primary Duties And Responsibilities
The Finance Assistant - Kano shall be responsible for the following:

Accounting & Financial Management:


	Provide initial review of all invoices/payment requests and initiate timely action in line with Project procedures/processes towards processing such payments;
	Support in preparation of weekly Field Vouchers for review and final submission by the Finance Manager.
	Manage all staff travel/activity advances, ensuring they are timeously liquidated, reconciled and reported in line with Lafiya Programme procedures.
	Support the Finance Manager in accounts reconciliations, which includes but not limited to:


Activity Advance Liquidation:


	Preparations and review of payment vouchers.
	Reconciliation of vendors’ statements prior to payment of any invoices;
	Support the Finance Manager in Overseeing the maintenance of robust filing system for easy retrieval of documents, finance documentation - both hard and electronic copies.
	Assist the Finance Manager in preparation of HQ monthly spending forecasts, trackers maintenance and expenditure variance reporting.
	Provide effective cover in the event of the absence of the Finance Coordinator from duty.
	Any other duties as directed by the Finance Manager.


Reporting Requirements:
The role reports to the National Finance Manager. Reporting requirements include:


	Provision of regular updates to the Finance Manager
	Monthly submission of HQ forecasts;
	Weekly Field Vouchers
	Post payment reviews of PVs for audit preparations
	Other reporting as requested by the line manager.


Relationships:


	The role will form part of the Project Financial Management team and will work closely with members of the Lafiya Programme team (and particularly the Finance Manager) as well as other Palladium programme teams in Nigeria, Financial Management team members across the company and the technical Practice Areas.
	The role liaises with the Finance Coordinator, Finance Manager, HQ Technical Teams, the broader Lafiya Administration team, vendors, service providers, and other project staff and stakeholders as required.


Required Qualifications


	University Degree or its equivalent in Business Administration, Accounting, Project Management or Social Sciences.
	Progressive years of experience providing finance support.
	Excellent cross-cultural communication and interpersonal skills demonstrated by ability to interact professionally with culturally and linguistically diverse staff, clients and consultants.
	Ability to prioritise and manage a variety of activities with attention to detail.
	Intermediate level skills in Microsoft Office Suite and comfortable in a Windows PC environment.

title: Job Vacancies at ResumeSurge
content:
ResumeSurge connects ambitious businesses with exceptional talent. We are a forward-thinking recruitment consultancy dedicated to helping companies find the right people to drive their success — and helping skilled professionals find the right opportunities to advance their careers.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

1.) Project Officer - ISP / Telecom

Job Location: Lekki, Lagos 
Employment Type: Full-time (Onsite)

About the Role
     

            
    




	We are hiring a detail-oriented Project Officer - ISP / Telecom to bridge the gap between technical teams and end-users, ensuring smooth execution of installations and projects.
	This role requires strong communication, documentation, and coordination skills.


Key Responsibilities


	Act as the liaison between end-users and the technical team.
	Negotiate project-related deals and agreements.
	Document project transactions, materials, and installations.
	Organize and follow up on client requests and ensure timely delivery.
	Generate and manage project reports using Excel and other tools.
	Work under pressure to meet project timelines.
	Collaborate across teams to resolve challenges quickly.


Requirements


	Candidates should possess a Bachelor's Degree.
	Minimum 2 years of experience in a similar role.
	Strong negotiation and collaboration skills.
	Excellent documentation and organizational abilities.
	High attention to detail.
	Proficiency in Microsoft Excel.
	Good communication skills and ability to work in a fast-paced environment.


Benefits


	Salary: N200,000 (Net) monthly + Benefits
	HMO
	Paid annual leave
	Transportation allowance (including up to the mainland)
	Staff pension scheme
	Group life assurance
	Staff retirement and death-in-service benefit scheme.


Application Closing Date: 30th September, 2025.

Click here to apply online

 

2.) Field Engineer - ISP / Telecom

|Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	We are looking for a proactive Field Engineer to carry out network installations, maintenance, and on-site troubleshooting for our ISP / telecommunications customers.
	This role involves hands-on work with networking hardware and requires excellent customer service skills.


Key Responsibilities


	Install, configure, and maintain networking equipment (routers, switches, modems, cabling) at customer sites.
	Diagnose and resolve network connectivity issues on-site.
	Perform routine maintenance checks and equipment upgrades.
	Use network diagnostic tools to identify and fix technical problems.
	Provide excellent customer service and communicate effectively with internal teams.
	Maintain accurate records of work performed and materials used.
	Travel to customer locations as needed.


Requirements


	High School Diploma or equivalent (technical certification or related Degree is a plus).
	Minimum of 2 years of experience in a similar role, preferably in ISP or telecoms.
	Strong understanding of networking concepts, protocols, and equipment.
	Proficiency in troubleshooting across Windows, Linux, and macOS environments.
	Good organizational and time-management skills.
	Valid driver’s license and willingness to travel.
	Physically able to lift and move networking equipment during installations.


Benefits


	Salary: N250,000 Monthly + Benefits.
	HMO
	Paid annual leave
	Transportation allowance (including up to mainland)
	Staff pension scheme
	Group life assurance
	Staff retirement and death-in-service benefit scheme.


Application Closing Date: 30th September, 2025.

Click here to apply online

 

3.) IP Operator - ISP / Telecom

Job Location: Lekki, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time, Onsite

About the Role


	We are seeking an experienced IP Operator to join our team in the ISP/telecoms sector.
	The ideal candidate will have strong expertise in networking engineering, hands-on experience with telecom-grade equipment, and the ability to ensure optimal network performance and reliability.


Key Responsibilities


	Configure, monitor, and maintain network devices including routers, switches, and firewalls.
	Implement and troubleshoot Layer 2 and Layer 3 protocols including VLAN, trunks, STP, EIGRP, OSPF, and BGP.
	Optimize network performance through proactive monitoring and problem resolution.
	Configure and maintain Mikrotik and Cisco devices.
	Manage and troubleshoot Unix-based servers (Redhat, CentOS, Debian).
	Implement and troubleshoot LAC/LNS systems.
	Work on MPLS (L2VPN, L3VPN, VPLS) setups.
	Configure and maintain Cisco ASA and Juniper firewalls.
	Provide escalation support for network-related incidents.


Requirements


	BSc Degree (or equivalent) in Computer Science, Computer Communication Engineering, or Telecommunications.
	Minimum 3 years of experience in networking engineering within an ISP or telecoms environment.
	CCNA certification (mandatory).
	In-depth knowledge of the TCP/IP protocol stack.
	Strong troubleshooting and diagnostic skills.
	Excellent communication and teamwork abilities.


Salary
N300,000 - N350,000 Net monthly.

Benefits:


	HMO
	Paid annual leave
	Transportation allowance (including up to mainland)
	Staff pension scheme
	Group life assurance
	Staff retirement and death-in-service benefit scheme.


Application Closing Date: 10th September, 2025.

title: Job Openings at LinkOrg Networks
content:
LinkOrg Networks is an engineering solution company established to provide satellite communications services and support for Fixed VSAT remote internet solutions, marine/offshore internet and applications, video broadcasting services, Information Technology, and telecommunications services. We are passionate about satellite communications and committed to delivering high standards. Telecommunication and satellite communication specialists manage the company, and our support is implemented using our network of highly trained and talented engineers and technicians.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Fiber Technician
     

            
    



Job Location: Victoria Island, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
Reports to: Technical Manager

Job Description


	The Fiber Optic Engineer is responsible for the design, installation, maintenance, and troubleshooting of fiber optic networks to ensure efficient and reliable service delivery.
	This role is crucial in the expansion and maintenance of the Internet Service Provider (ISP) infrastructure, ensuring high-quality connectivity for customers.


Key Responsibilities
Fibre Optic Network Design and Planning:


	Design and develop fiber optic network layouts, including FTTH (Fiber to the Home), FTTx (Fiber to the X), and backbone networks.
	Conduct site surveys and feasibility studies to determine the optimal placement of fiber optic cables and equipment.
	Prepare detailed engineering drawings, schematics, and technical documentation for fiber optic network projects.


Installation and Commissioning:


	Oversee the installation, splicing, and testing of fiber optic cables, ensuring compliance with industry standards and specifications.
	Configure and install networking equipment, such as optical line terminals (OLTs), optical network terminals (ONTs), and routers.
	Perform end-to-end testing, including OTDR (Optical Time Domain Reflectometer) testing, power meter testing, and light source testing.


Maintenance and Troubleshooting:


	Monitor the performance of fiber optic networks and diagnose issues using appropriate testing tools and equipment.
	Conduct routine inspections, maintenance, and repairs of fiber optic cables, connectors, and network components.
	Respond to and resolve network outages and disruptions in a timely manner to minimize downtime for customers.


Documentation and Reporting:


	Maintain accurate records of fiber optic network configurations, installations, and maintenance activities.
	Prepare technical reports, as-built documentation, and maintenance logs.
	Provide regular updates and reports to the Network Operations Manager on project progress and network performance.


Project Management:


	Plan, schedule, and manage fiber optic installation and maintenance projects, ensuring timely completion within budget.
	Coordinate with contractors, vendors, and other stakeholders to ensure seamless execution of fiber optic projects.
	Ensure that all work is carried out in accordance with safety regulations, industry standards, and company policies.


Customer Support:


	Provide technical support to customers and field technicians regarding fiber optic connectivity issues.
	Assist in resolving customer complaints related to network performance and service quality.
	Conduct on-site visits to troubleshoot and resolve customer issues when necessary.


Quality Assurance:


	Implement and enforce quality control measures to ensure the reliability and performance of fiber optic networks.
	Regularly review and update technical procedures and standards to align with best practices and technological advancements.


Training and Development:


	Provide training and guidance to junior engineers and technicians on fiber optic installation, splicing, and maintenance techniques.
	Stay updated with the latest developments in fiber optic technology and industry trends.


Qualifications


	Bachelor’s degree in Electrical Engineering, Telecommunications, or a related field.
	3+ years of experience in fiber optic network design, installation, and maintenance, preferably within the ISP industry.
	Proficiency in fiber optic splicing, testing, and troubleshooting techniques.
	Experience with fiber optic equipment, such as OTDRs, fusion splicers, power meters, and light sources.
	Strong understanding of FTTH, FTTx, and other fiber optic network architectures.
	Familiarity with networking protocols, standards, and equipment.
	Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
	Ability to work independently and manage multiple projects simultaneously.


Preferred Qualifications:


	Certifications in fiber optics, such as Certified Fiber Optic Technician (CFOT) or equivalent.
	Experience with GIS mapping software and network design tools.
	Knowledge of IP networking, routing, and switching.


Work Environment:


	Fieldwork involving site visits, installation, and troubleshooting of fiber optic networks.
	Office-based work for network design, documentation, and reporting.
	Some travel may be required to different project sites and customer locations.
	Occasional on-call work may be required to address urgent network issues.


Salary
N250,000 - N275,000 Monthly.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their Resume and Cover Letter to: recruit@linkorgnet.com using “Fiber Engineer” as the subject of the email.

 

 

2.) Sales Executive

Job Location: Victoria Island, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
Reports To: Chief Sales Officer

Job Summary


	The Sales Executive will be responsible for driving sales and revenue growth by identifying and pursuing new business opportunities, maintaining relationships with existing clients, and promoting the company's internet and networking solutions.
	The role requires a proactive individual with a deep understanding of the industry, excellent communication skills, and a proven track record in sales.


Key Responsibilities
Client Acquisition:


	Identify and target potential customers, including businesses, residential clients, and other organizations that require internet and networking solutions.
	Conduct market research to identify new sales opportunities and trends in the ISP industry.
	Generate leads through cold calling, networking, referrals, and online research.


Sales Process:


	Conduct sales presentations and product demonstrations to prospective clients, highlighting the benefits of the company’s services.
	Prepare and deliver compelling sales proposals and quotations tailored to the client’s needs.
	Negotiate terms and close sales deals, ensuring alignment with company goals and customer satisfaction.
	Follow up with prospects to move them through the sales pipeline and convert them into customers.


Relationship Management:


	Develop and maintain strong, long-lasting relationships with clients to ensure satisfaction and encourage repeat business.
	Act as the main point of contact for clients, addressing inquiries, resolving issues, and providing ongoing support.
	Regularly update clients on new products, services, and promotions.


Sales Targets and Reporting:


	Meet or exceed monthly, quarterly, and annual sales targets as set by the Sales Manager.
	Maintain accurate and up-to-date records of all sales activities, client interactions, and transactions in the CRM system.
	Prepare regular sales reports for management, including forecasts, performance analysis, and market feedback.


Product Knowledge:


	Stay informed about the company’s products, services, and pricing as well as industry developments and competitors’ offerings.
	Provide clients with expert advice on the best solutions to meet their internet and networking needs.


Collaboration:


	Work closely with the Sales Manager, marketing team, and technical staff to align sales strategies with company objectives.
	Participate in sales meetings, training sessions, and industry events to enhance knowledge and skills.


Educational Qualifications


	Bachelor’s Degree in Business Administration, Marketing, Telecommunications, or a related field.


Experience:


	Minimum of 3-6 years of sales experience, preferably in the ISP or telecommunications industry.
	Proven track record of meeting or exceeding sales targets.


Skills:


	Strong understanding of internet and networking technologies and services.
	Excellent communication, negotiation, and interpersonal skills.
	Ability to build and maintain relationships with clients and stakeholders.
	Proficiency in using CRM software and other sales tools.
	Self-motivated, results-oriented, and able to work independently as well as part of a team.


Other Requirements:


	Willingness to travel as needed to meet clients and attend industry events.
	Valid driver’s license is a plus.


Salary
N300,000 - N350,000 / Month and commission structure.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their Resume and Cover Letter to: recruit@linkorgnet.com using “Sales Executive” as the subject of the mail.

 

 

3.) Office Assistant / Janitor

Job Location: Victoria Island, Lagos (Onsite)
Employment Type: Full-time
Department: Facility
Reporting to: Facility Manager
Supervises: Nil
External Relates to: Nil
Work Hours: 08:00am – 05:00pm

Job Overview


	An Office Assistant / Janitor at Linkorg Networks Limited is responsible for maintaining cleanliness and orderliness within the company’s facilities.
	This role is very important in ensuring a safe and hygienic work environment for employees and visitors.


Job Duties / Responsibilities


	Clean, dust, and mop floors in all areas, including offices, hallways, and restrooms
	Empty trash bins, dispose of waste properly, and replace liners.
	Clean and sanitize restrooms, including toilets, sinks, and mirrors, and restock supplies as needed.
	Wipe and sanitize surfaces such as desks, tables, and countertops.
	Wash windows, mirrors, and glass doors to maintain a streak-free appearance
	Vacuum carpets and rugs in common areas, offices, and hallways.
	Replenish cleaning supplies and inform the supervisor when stock needs to be ordered.
	Maintain cleaning equipment in good working condition and report any issues for repair.
	Follow safety protocols and guidelines when handling cleaning chemicals and equipment.
	Perform periodic deep cleaning tasks such as shampooing carpets, cleaning light fixtures, and scrubbing grout.
	Report any damages or maintenance issues to the manager.
	Respond to emergency cleaning requests promptly (e.g., spills).


Key Performance Indicators


	
		
			
			S/N
			
			
			KPI’s
			
			
			Weight
			
			
			Delivery Timelines
			
		
		
			
			1
			
			
			Cleaning Efficiency: Measures the number of cleaning tasks completed accurately and on time (e.g., daily cleaning of offices, restrooms, hallways).

			Target: Complete 100% of scheduled cleaning tasks daily without any complaints from staff or management.
			
			
			30%
			
			
			Daily, with monthly reviews
			
		
		
			
			2
			
			
			Waste Management and Disposal: Tracks the frequency and proper disposal of trash bins and waste management.

			Target: Empty all trash bins and replace liners in all designated areas with a compliance rate of 100% daily.
			
			
			20%
			
			
			Daily with weekly checks for compliance
			
		
		
			
			3
			
			
			Restroom Sanitation and Supplies: Monitors the cleanliness of restrooms and the availability of supplies (e.g., tissue paper, soap).

			Target: Achieve a cleanliness rating of at least 95% based on random inspections and ensure all supplies are stocked with zero stockouts.
			
			
			20%
			
			
			Twice daily checks, with weekly reviews
			
		
		
			
			4
			
			
			Cleaning Equipment Maintenance: Measures the proper maintenance and functioning of cleaning equipment and timely reporting of issues.

			Target: Maintain cleaning equipment with no more than 2 instances of equipment malfunction per quarter. Report any issues within 1 hour of detection.
			
			
			15%
			
			
			Ongoing, with quarterly evaluations.
			
		
		
			
			5
			
			
			Emergency Response Time: Evaluates the speed and effectiveness of response to emergency cleaning requests (e.g., spills).

			Target: Respond to 100% of emergency cleaning requests within 5 minutes and complete the task within 15 minutes.
			
			
			15%
			
			
			As required, with monthly performance reviews
			
		
	


Required Skills and Competencies


	SSCE qualification or equivalent.
	Previous experience as an Office Assistant / Janior is preferred but not mandatory.
	Knowledge of cleaning chemicals and supplies.
	Ability to follow instructions and work independently.
	Attention to detail.
	Time management skills.
	Good communication skills.
	Physical stamina for lifting and moving heavy objects.


Salary
N70,000 - N100,000 / Month.

Method of  Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV / Resume and Cover Letter to: recruit@linkorgnet.com using “Office Assistant / Janitor” as the subject of the email.
